thread.title: Stardew Valley Update: Stardew Valley Update 1.6.4: Everything we so far
thread.title_full: Stardew Valley Update: Stardew Valley Update 1.6.4: Everything we know so far - The Economic Times

title: Stardew Valley Update: Stardew Valley Update 1.6.4: Everything we so far
text: Stardew Valley players have been enjoying the latest major update, 1.6, since its release on March 19. This update introduced a new Mastery system, crops, events, and various quality of life improvements. However, the excitement doesn't end there, as the next patch, Update 1.6.4, is on its way, promising to address bugs and add some exciting new features, as per a Dexerto report.Release DateConcerned Ape, the developer of Stardew Valley, announced on Twitter that Update 1.6.4 is expected to go live sometime between April 15 and 21. Initially, the update will only be available on PC, with console and mobile versions to follow once the porting process is complete.What's Changing?Update 1.6.4 primarily focuses on bug fixes that have emerged since the launch of Update 1.6. Additionally, players can look forward to a few goodies, details of which are being kept secret for now. Dev comments suggest there will be a new feature for the Fishing system and some additions to Mining as well.Console and Mobile ReleasesConcerned Ape reassures players that the release of Update 1.6.4 won't impact the scheduled release of Stardew Valley on consoles and mobile devices. The porting of the major 1.6 update to these platforms is still underway, and 1.6.4 will be available on consoles and mobiles once this process is complete.FAQs:When will Stardew Valley Update 1.6.4 be released?The update is expected between April 15 and 21, initially on PCs, with consoles and mobiles to follow.What can players expect from Update 1.6.4?The update will fix bugs from 1.6 and add new features, including enhancements to the Fishing and Mining systems, with additional surprises teased by Concerned Ape.", 109227440,resizemode- 29926,overlay-
